page.title: 01SOUTHBOROUGH AND AREA
page.content: {Southborough} is surrounded by the open country of the High Weald and straddles the A26. The traffic on this road, 20,000 cars a day, dominates the town. There are 65 hectares of housing on each side of the A26. 95% of the shops and offices are spread along this road in two main groups. Corner shops are found throughout the area. Most of the services for the area are provided by {Tonbridge} and {Tunbridge Wells.} Southborough is surrounded by small hamlets: Modest Corner, Nonsuch Green and Great Bounds. To the east is High Brooms, an area that reflects the rapid growth of brick and tile manufacturing in the late C19th. Bidborough to the north-west is a commuter village with much high-value housing. Southborough is a dormitory town with a population that commutes locally and to {London.}
